missed.title: Reflected XSS in Name Parameter
missed.reason: The penetration test did not identify the reflected XSS vulnerability in the name parameter (app.py lines 69-71). While the test found infrastructure issues like missing security headers that could facilitate XSS attacks, it did not discover the actual XSS filter bypass vulnerability in the application's name parameter filtering logic. This represents a critical miss as XSS vulnerabilities can lead to session hijacking, cookie theft, and arbitrary JavaScript execution in victim browsers.

extra.title: Inconsistent HTTP Method Response Codes Enable Endpoint Enumeration
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - This is a legitimate information disclosure vulnerability allowing attackers to enumerate valid endpoints by observing different HTTP status codes (405 vs 404) for different HTTP methods. Not a false positive.

extra.title: Path Traversal in Static File Route
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - While Flask's routing limits immediate impact, the path traversal mechanism itself is functional and represents a security control failure that could be exploited under different configurations. Not a false positive.

extra.title: Business Logic Flaw - Inaccessible XSS25 Challenge Endpoint
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Legitimate business logic flaw where advertised functionality is not available. While lower severity, this indicates incomplete implementation and poor application design. Not a false positive.

extra.title: Broken Challenge Link - xss25 Endpoint Returns 404
extra.assessment: Duplicate finding - This is essentially the same issue as 'Business Logic Flaw - Inaccessible XSS25 Challenge Endpoint'. Both findings describe the same broken link/endpoint problem.

extra.title: Information Disclosure Through Server Headers
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Legitimate information disclosure issue revealing Werkzeug 1.0.1 and Python 2.7.18 versions, enabling targeted attacks. Not a false positive.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers Allow Multiple Client-Side Attacks
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Absence of security headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, etc.) is a legitimate security misconfiguration that weakens defense-in-depth. Not a false positive.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers
extra.assessment: Duplicate finding - This is the same issue as 'Missing Security Headers Allow Multiple Client-Side Attacks', just documented with different severity and detail level.

extra.title: Use of End-of-Life Python 2.7.18
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Critical finding identifying use of EOL software with known unpatched CVEs (CVE-2021-3177, CVE-2020-26116, etc.). This is a serious security issue. Not a false positive.

extra.title: Use of Werkzeug Development Server (Not Production-Ready)
extra.assessment: Valid new discovery - Legitimate configuration issue where a development server is being used instead of production-grade WSGI server, creating performance and security risks. Not a false positive.
